participant_1.name: Emily Thompson
participant_1.personality: Energetic, optimistic, and nurturing, I find joy in teaching and inspiring others.
participant_1.background: I keep my students on their toes by keeping my lessons engaging and energetic. I'm in an education program, and hope to teach kindergarten when I graduate. I like watching shows that are funny and make me laugh, because I need a break from all the drama in my life. I'm looking for a home in the country where I can enjoy my vintage cars and the peace and quiet of the winter season. I am overall happy with life.

participant_2.name: Jordan Lee
participant_2.personality: Creative, sociable, and humorous, I enjoy entertaining others and making life enjoyable.
participant_2.background: I cook cheap but delicious food that my friends love and use my apple devices to keep my life organized. My father used to drive a taxi cab in the 1970s. My parents are not into LARP, but they support my hobby. I play jazz piano in a band. I also dance and sing.

content.text: Not much, just relaxing at home. How are you?
Doing well! Just finished a long day of work. I'm an education student, and I'm hoping to teach kindergarten when I graduate.
That's awesome! I'm sure you'll be a great teacher. I love kids!
Thanks! Me too. I think it's important to make learning fun and engaging for kids, so they actually enjoy school.
I agree! I think it's really important to make learning a positive experience for kids.
What do you do for a living?
I'm a musician. I play jazz piano in a band. I also dance and sing.
That's awesome! I love music! What kind of music do you play?
I play a variety of genres, but I mostly play jazz. I also like to play some blues and funk.
That's great! I love jazz. I used to play the saxophone in high school.
That's awesome! I've always wanted to learn the saxophone.
It's a great instrument! It's a lot of fun to play.
I bet it is! I've always loved the sound of the saxophone.
It's a really versatile instrument. You can play anything from jazz to classical music.
That's awesome! I'll have to look into learning it sometime.
